extendedMetadata.name: Objective
extendedMetadata.value: LO: 8.4: Why did the United States find it difficult to avoid military conflict during this period?

subject: US History
metadata.bookAuthor: H. W. Brands; T. H. Breen; R. Hal Williams; Ariela J. Gros
metadata.title: FA Understand 08 04

config.question: How did France respond in 1806 to Britain’s “paper blockades”?

choices.content: It set up the Continental System, which made neutral vessels carrying British goods liable to seizure.
It passed the Embargo Act, which would force Britain to negotiate with France in good faith.
It issued a set of trade regulations known as the Orders in Council, which allowed France to monitor every Continental port.
It negotiated a commercial treaty with Britain that allowed American vessels to pay nominal customs and then sail to France.

answer_3.response: Consider This: The Americans were caught between two conflicting systems. This unhappy turn of international events baffled Jefferson. He had assumed that justice obliged civilized countries to respect neutral rights. See L.O. 8.4 Why did the United States find it difficult to avoid military conflict during this period?
